column5: I've had a pretty messed up experience with trout and salmon in streams, I mean I've got them angry enough to strike a pink jig just by standing in front of them. The craziest thing i've seen was a salmon open its mouth to take in a small single egg. Coincidence? I don't know, but the way I sometimes see people force feeding steelhead in inches of water and legally hooking them in the mouth makes me confused. What are some experiences with trout and salmon that have let you know they really do take small bright things in rivers?
Oh boy!
Are you serious? lol.
Simple answer to a very simple question.   Quickly   Rapala boy to the rescue...
Roy, stay out of the water, the salmon and trout are after small, bright things, yah know. HH
You've gotta be kidding me....It's a serious question
He doesn't have time Joe he's still shovelling on other threads..
Well Joe, I can never be accused of being bright as for being small, I'll plead guilty to that one all day long.
I guess i'll just continue shoving Kwikfish in their faces when winter comes.
how do you see your food?
Well...I look at it from a distance (12 inches approx), but I.....oh I think I know what you mean.
lol
And how does it smell?LOL!
Sometimes I just sit back and laugh
LOL, And watch ufc on the river bank ,Via live!
HAHA

You could ask the same question about trout in streams gobbling up my size 24 nymphs (less than a 1/4 inch in length).  Their senses are tuned to grab tiny things and eat them...especially familiar things.  They see it, they know what it is and they eat it.  If its not what they thought it was, out it goes!  I suppose its kind of like you walking through the bush and seeing a lone raspberry on a bush...what goes through your mind?
Oh, and come winter, you should be after steelhead...shouldn't you??
If you're not careful a grizzlies paw!!!
ahhahahaha....  Oh Ya.... it's the steelhead i'll be after in the winter creeks.....until I get a dry suit and still manage to kill myself in the kayak.
Yeah, but this is OFC, not YFN!!
